description: Filter for Devon Town geographies
Area identifier for LSOA code, Devon Town, Ward name, Locality or Cluster name.
Relative deprivation in small areas in England https://www.gov.uk/government/statistics/english-indices-of-deprivation-2015
Relative deprivation in small areas in England https://data.gov.uk/dataset/imd_2004

Proportion of the population experiencing deprivation relating to low income. The definition of low income used includes both those people that are out-of-work, and those that are in work but who have low earnings (and who satisfy the respective means tests).

Proportion of the working-age population in an area involuntarily excluded from the labour market. This includes people who would like to work but are unable to do so due to unemployment, sickness or disability, or caring responsibilities.
Unplanned admissions to a hospital bed (excluding transfers) per 100,000 people.
Elective and planned admissions to a hospital bed (excluding transfers) per 100,000 people.
Urgent care activity (A&E, walk-in centres and minor injury unit) per 100,000 people.
Admissions with accidental fall ICD10 W0 or W1 in any diagnosis field, per 100,00 people.
Admissions to hospitals with alcohol-specific cause, or alcohol-related cause (using 2008 definitions) per 100,00 people.
Average number of years a person would expect to live based on contemporary mortality rates.
Average number of years a person would expect to live based on contemporary mortality rates.
Number of live births per 1000 females aged between 15 and 44 in the area.
Percentage of people claiming Department of Work and Pensions (DWP) benefits compared to the  working age (16 to 64) population.

Percentage of households that experience fuel poverty based on the "low income, high cost" methodology, where required fuel costs are above the national average and where spending that amount would be left with a residual income below the poverty line
Percentage of people claiming Department of Work and Pensions (DWP) benefits compared to the  working age (16 to 64) population.
Percentage of people claiming Employment Support Allowance (ESA) or incapacity benefits compared to the  working age (16 to 64) population.
Percentage of people receiving benefits who are in the carers client group.
Percentage of people receiving benefits who are in the disabled client group.
Percentage of people receiving benefits who are aged between 16 and 24.
Number of people killed or seriously injured on the roads, per 100,000 resident population.
Number of pupils at the end of Key Stage 4 in schools maintained by the local education authority, achieving five or more GCSEs above grade C or equivalent.
Number of enquiries to the MASH as a rate per 1,000 people aged 0 to 17.
Number of children unlikely to reach or maintain a satisfactory level of health, as a percentage of all persons aged 0 to 24.
Number of pupils (primary and secondary) for whom English is an additional language, as a percentage of all pupils.
Number of children in any special education needs category, as a percentage of all pupils.
Percentage of primary and secondary school pupils in an area who attend a school rated as good or outstanding.
Number of Early Help DAF assessments undertaken as a percentage of all persons aged 0 to 24 in the area.
Proportion of all adults with a learning disability known to the council who are recorded as living In their own home or with their family.
Number of permanent admissions to residential and nursing care homes in the area, per 100,000 population aged 65 and over.
Proportion of new adult social care service uses receiving a short-term service during the year.
Number of 16 to 18 year olds not in education, employment or training.
Referrals to the Improving Access to Physical Therapies (IAPT) programme, per 100,000 population aged 16 and over.
